oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A note on fear reaction of three different genetic strains of laying hens to a simulated hawk attack in the hen run of a free-range system
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Zeltner, Esther
Hirt, Helen
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Poultry
Breeding and genetics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Hens well adapted to free-range systems should react quickly to avoid an attack by a predator but should also be able to return to the hen run soon after to ensure good use of the outside area.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Zeltner, Esther and Hirt, Helen (2008) A note on fear reaction of three different genetic strains of laying hens to a simulated hawk attack in the hen run of a free-range system. Applied Animal Behaviour Science, Issues 1-3 (113), pp. 69-73.
